title: Undefined behavior when using `diesel::sql_query` with an empty string for Sqlite
body:
## Setup

### Versions

- **Rust:** rustc 1.80.1
- **Diesel:** v2.2.3
- **Database:** sqlite 3.44.1
- **Operating System** Linux

### Feature Flags

- **diesel:** sqlite

## Problem Description

This code has UB:
```rust
use diesel::{Connection, RunQueryDsl, SqliteConnection};

fn main() {
    let mut conn = SqliteConnection::establish("tmp.sqlite").unwrap();
    diesel::sql_query("").execute(&mut conn).unwrap();
}
```

Output with `cargo run`:
```

stack backtrace:

[1]    6997 abort (core dumped)
```

It seems the problem is linked to the [`sqlite3_prepare_v3`](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/08911c8420f4e2ff732a3b263a5a4f3df0f745d2/diesel/src/sqlite/connection/stmt.rs#L37) call (see [sqlite doc](https://www.sqlite.org/c3ref/prepare.html)):
> If the input text contains no SQL (if the input is an empty string or a comment) then *ppStmt is set to NULL.
